subject: Bananas, avocados, and oranges
full_text: Hey it's Dr. Matt, Lead Medical Advisor here at BioTrust, and here's something controversial, but extremely true: You don't have to buy EVERYTHING organic to obtain a flat belly! Some foods are important, and others you can definitely get by with the regular stuff. For example, I always choose organic meats to avoid being exposed to the synthetic hormones that non-organic livestock is generally treated with throughout their life cycle. Sure, it's a little more expensive, but some things are just worth paying for -- protecting the health of my family is definitely one of them! That said, I'm all about saving cash where it makes sense, and that's why there are certain foods we NEVER buy organic. Why? Because for some foods, there is no additional benefit to the organic vs. the non-organic version. Let me explain. When it comes to produce, the benefit of buying organic is to avoid ingesting pesticides and chemicals that are generally used on non-organic fruits and vegetables. That said, foods like bananas, avocados, oranges, melons, and grapefruits have a thick skin barrier between the outside world and the fruit itself so the pesticides actually never come in contact with the fruit that you eat, and of course these are fruits where the outer layer is typically discarded. Contrast that with apples, tomatoes, pears, and other fruits and veggies where you eat the skin, and you'll see why it's important to choose organic for some and not for others. So, Rule #1, if a fruit has a thick skin that you discard and don't eat, save some cash and go with the non-organic version. Next up, there are other veggies that pests simply aren't attracted to due to their high sulfur content, such as onions and garlic. Don't bother spending the extra cash here either as these veggies aren't typically treated with pesticides in the first place. In the end, spend the money where there's benefit, and pinch those pennies when there's not! Re: The tilapia Now, while we're on the topic of foods to enjoy and those to avoid, I want to make sure you are aware of 4 specific types of fish -- all very common -- that you should literally NEVER eat due to incredibly high levels of contamination that can and WILL hammer the delicate cells of your body with toxic inflammation... In the end, this toxic inflammation build up contributes to achy joints, premature aging of the skin (and less visible organs like the heart, kidneys, and liver), difficulty shedding excess weight, cognitive decline, forgetfulness, feeling blue and moody, and so much more... I show you all 4 fish at the link below -- avoid these 4 types of fish like the plague! ==> NEVER eat this type of fish (EVER) Watch out! subject: 4500% better than Turmeric
full_text: Hi, it's BioTrust medical advisor Dr. Matt Roberson and today we're going to reveal to you the exciting details of a brand new, breakthrough formula so powerful that it's been shown through peer-reviewed research to roll back up to 17 years of degenerative cellular aging... yes, you read that right, 17 years! Best yet, today we're making it EASIER than ever to get your hands on this "age-defying miracle" with HUGE discounts and FREE shipping -- all while helping you drastically reduce the belly-fat producing, age-accelerating hormone cortisol 6.4Xs lower! Let me ask you a question: Did you know that every single second at least one person dies from an age-related condition? Whatâ€™s more, research estimates that by the year 2020 the percentage of aging-related deaths will increase another 25%! Just think, are you experiencing any of these telltale signs that â€œFather Timeâ€ is closing in on you and knocking on your door? *Skin issues (such as dry skin, age spots, wrinkles, and saggy skin) *Loss of sexual desire and/or sexual function *Joint discomfort, stiffness, and/or swelling *Weakened muscles *Frail bones *Memory and other cognitive issues *Declining vision and auditory skills *Decreased energy and increased fatigue *A weakening immune system, leaving you sick more and more often *An underperforming circulatory system *A cardiovascular system that just canâ€™t support a truly active lifestyle any longer *Hormonal decline *Feeling blue and moody *Dulling, thinning hair *Loss of muscle tone and your youthful figure *Slowed metabolism and perpetual weight gain And thatâ€™s just naming a few! Even more, are these same despairs of aging disrupting your life, preventing you from doing the things and activities you love most? Have you been sidelined due to your struggle with weakened muscles, joints and bones, reduced lung power, and/or decreased energy reserves? And even more sobering, are you concerned about losing your freedom due to age-related vision, hearing, and seemingly inevitable mental decline? Have the woes of aging left you feeling undesirable, unwanted, undervalued by society, or unimportant? Fact is, these common concerns and the unescapable reality of aging are no laughing matter. Even worse, there are a host of environmental and lifestyle factors that are constantly preying on the youth of every cell of your body: *UV rays that damage the DNA of skin cells, leading to thinning skin, sun spots, wrinkles, exaggerated expression lines, and even pervasive dryness and itching *Stress, which sends the age-accelerating hormone cortisol into overdrive *Mood-related issues which have been linked to as much as a decade of accelerated aging *Lack of sleep shown to significantly shorten the length of DNA telomeres (AKA your â€œcellular timekeepersâ€) *Too much or too little exercise -- studies show that both the highly active and sedentary populations have similar age-related biomarkers as a result of too little or too much of a good thing *Poor nutrition, leading to a lack of antioxidants and essential vitamins and minerals that fight the aging process *Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) infiltrating our diet which have been linked to poor immune function and accelerated aging *Excessive Omega-6 fatty acid intake â€“ the most prevalent fatty acid in the American diet â€“ which has been shown to accelerate aging and significantly increase inflammation *Highly processed carbohydrates and sugar intake which promote the formation of AGEs (Advanced Glycation End-products). These mutated proteins have been shown to significantly accelerate cellular aging. *Overeating in general, which produces age-accelerating free radicals *Alcohol consumption, which decreases the bodyâ€™s antioxidant activity while at the same time increasing cell-damaging free radicals â€“ a double whammy! *Being overweight, which by itself leads to a state of increased cell-damaging oxidative stress *Over-the-counter and prescription medications, a good number of which have been linked to accelerated aging *Pesticides, herbicides, pollution, and other environmental toxins have all been shown to increase the appearance of skin aging and do damage to delicate skin DNA Simply put, the world we live in today takes what Mother Nature intended to be a much more gradual, graceful aging process full of vitality and longevity, and accelerates it unfairly beyond belief. And when you realize the constant danger the delicate cells of your body and most precious organs are continually being exposed to in todayâ€™s day and age, itâ€™s no wonder that research shows the devastating physical consequences of aging are the #1 fear of adults over 40. Are you worried aboutâ€¦ *The nightmare of looking decades older than your actual age? *The fear of losing your freedom due to an aging, frail and weakened body and deteriorating mental abilities? *The dread of not being around to see your grandchildren graduate school and go on to get married? *The fear of no longer being desired by your partner or valued by society? It all sounds very overwhelming, and it is. The fortunate news, however, is that there IS something you can do about it. Even better, the answer is found in a brand new synergistic blend of 5 research-backed age-defying â€œsuper nutrientsâ€ that we call Ageless Bodyâ„¢ -- a formula so powerful that it is actually able to significantly slow the aging process while at the same time: **Rolling back up to 17 years of degenerative cellular aging! **Combatting external â€œphoto agingâ€, notably improving skin tone & elasticity, and minimizing wrinkles **Reducing melanin (the molecule responsible for dark spots) by a whopping 30% **Significantly increasing the hormones responsible for skin brightness and that â€œyouthful glowâ€ **Drastically reducing the belly-fat producing, age-accelerating hormone cortisol 6.4Xs lower! **Reducing sleeplessness and improving quality of sleep by 66% **Significantly firming and tightening aged skin, especially loose skin **Dramatically increasing feelings of wellbeing by 36Xs! And it does it all while maintaining and significantly reducing the degradation of the most important aging biomarker ever discovered â€“ the length of your â€œcellular timekeepersâ€, known as telomeres. But how exactly does Ageless Bodyâ„¢ provide all of these incredible anti-aging, cell-rejuvenating benefits in just two small capsules, twice daily? In order to understand that, we first have to understand WHY we age, and there are 3 major root causesâ€¦ 1. Degradation of your â€œcellular timekeepersâ€, known as telomeres. Telomeres are the â€œprotective capsâ€ at the end of each strand of cellular DNA that control aging. In fact, telomeres are so critically important to aging that some within the medical community are now calling telomeres your â€œeternal youth genesâ€, and for good reason. You see, every day the cells in your body divide as many as 2 trillion times. Old cells die, and the body replaces them with a duplicate. While these new cells are indeed duplicates, like a photocopied image they are slightly less perfect than the original. Whatâ€™s more, a 2009 Nobel Prize-winning discovery revealed that with each cell division, itâ€™s the telomeres (those protective caps at the end of DNA) that are slightly degraded and over time become significantly reduced in size. Think of the protective plastic tips at the end of your shoe laces. When those deteriorate, the entire shoe lace unravels. Itâ€™s the same thing with your telomeres and the delicate cells of your body. Worse yet, as your telomeres degrade and shorten, your body ages more rapidly. The cold, hard truth is this: As aging accelerates, each year you live what is ultimately a lower and lower quality of life until eventually your telomeres â€œexpireâ€ and the inevitable happens: you die. But itâ€™s not all bad newsâ€¦ You see, this same breakthrough medical research also shows that if you can boost the health of your telomeres and keep them from degrading and shortening, you can dramatically slow the aging process and add many high-quality, vivacious and productive years to your life! This means that even when your chronological age goes up, your cells stay young and vibrant! Weâ€™ve all seen a 50 year old man or woman who doesnâ€™t look a day past 40 and other 50 year olds who look like they could easily pass for 65. As the old adage goes, your actual age is just a number â€“ whatâ€™s of prime importance, however, is your cellular age, or how old (or young) your body looks, feels, performs, and functions. The primary enzyme responsible for keeping telomeres strong, healthy and long is called telomerase. And even better, youâ€™ll be happy to know that all 5 ingredients in Ageless Bodyâ„¢ work together synergistically to supercharge telomerase production and keep your bodyâ€™s cellular timekeepersâ€”your telomeresâ€”healthy, youthful, and full of life! 2. Progressive death over time to your bodyâ€™s main â€œpower sourceâ€, your mitochondria. Mitochondria are the power plants of our bodyâ€™s cells. Simply put, the more energy the mitochondria produce, the younger and healthier we feel. As we get older, however, mitochondria decrease in number, by as much as 50%! Not only that, but the mitochondria that remain only work at 50% of their original capacity! With only half the â€œpower linesâ€ operating at 50% capacity, there isnâ€™t nearly as much energy pumping to your joints, heart, brain, lungs, and immune system. In the end, your ability to live, breathe, move, and be energetic is severely compromised. Fortunately, Ageless Bodyâ„¢ was also specifically and scientifically formulated to dramatically improve mitochondria performance and function, giving you the upper hand on this seemingly unavoidable source of accelerated aging. 3. Free radical exposure and resulting oxidative damage (i.e. the â€œrustingâ€ of your bodyâ€™s cells). One of the main causes of cellular aging is free radicals, also known as â€œoxidantsâ€. Essentially, free radicals are energy deficient molecules who seek and destroy healthy cells, stealing their energy and livelihood. If youâ€™ve ever seen an apple or avocado turn brown after you cut it, or metal rust, youâ€™ve witnessed oxidative stress at work. This same â€œrustingâ€ happens within the cells of your body when exposed to the sun (UV exposure), pollution, heavy metals, and even many positive stressors like exercise. Bottom line, there are simply way too many oxidative villains in modern living, and unless you proactively do something to defend yourself against these youth-robbing free radicals daily, you are undeniably going to get slaughteredâ€¦ Enter anti-oxidants, AKA your â€œcellular bodyguardsâ€. subject: How to kill stress before it kills you
full_text: Dorothy,It makes me so angry when I see the damage it causes.The lost health.The lost productivity.The lost happiness.The lost LIVES.Stress kills.Itâ€™s as simple as that.Numerous studies prove it beyond doubt. Maybe thatâ€™s nothing â€œnewâ€ to you.What is new is that scientists may finally have found the MECHANISMthat takes stress so lethal: a â€œKILLER CHEMICALâ€ (called IL-6)that rises sharply in the blood when weâ€™re stressed out. Studies link IL-6 to many deadly diseases, including type-2 diabetesand certain cancers.Now we know why many say that stress lies at the root of justabout every health problem and disease known to man,from heart disease, heart attack and stroke to overeating,insomnia and hypertensionâ€¦.All stress related.Studies show that 3 out of 4 doctor visits are the resultof stress. But hereâ€™s the good newsâ€¦The fastest way to reduce your stress levels on the spot is to simplydo nothing.To just sit quietly and let your mindâ€™s natural tranquility come to the fore.Thatâ€™s right, Iâ€™m talking about meditation!But weâ€™re talking science here, not New Age mystical.In one study, a major corporation had some of its employeestake six group meditation sessions over seven weeks. After the study, participants reported being more satisfied with their life. Situations and people that usually stressed them outdidnâ€™t faze them anymore.For those with depression it was practically eliminated.Donâ€™t want to spend a lot of time meditating?No problem. In just minutes, you can meditate and decompress.Feel better. And make yourself a lot more productive at the same time.But you have to know how. Itâ€™s not as simple as sitting down, closing your eyes and drifting away to â€œLa-La Land.â€ Fortunately, my good friend, Dr. Partha Nandi, is an expert atmindful meditation. And he would like to show you, absolutelyfree and without obligation, how to meditate by giving you access to hisâ€¦>>Calming the Chaos Meditation Series.Youâ€™ll learn how to melt away stress in just minutes a day.In this seven-day guided meditation audio series, Dr. Nandishows you how to: -- filter out the noise and distraction in your life-- release feelings of anxiety and tension within minutes-- relax your mind and body-- stop feelings of being overwhelmed-- heal yourself with the power of forgiveness-- visualize to manifest real results-- and develop an attitude of gratitudeAll in about 5 minutes a day!Why is Dr. Nandi giving away this important health resource?And why is he giving it away for free?As you may have heard, Dr. Nandi is on a mission to spreadthe #HealthHero Movement around the world. He wouldlike you to discover how to live a healthier and happierlife too. Just like thousands of others have. Learning how to calm your mind, steady your nerves andrelax in any situation is critical to living a healthy and joyful life. Meditation is the best way to get yourself calm, cool andcollected on the spot. And Calming the Chaos is the best, quickest and easiest wayIâ€™ve ever seen to get the life-altering benefits of meditation asquickly and easily as possible.>>Get access to it right here, right now.It wonâ€™t be available at no cost like this for long, so please hurry. To your health,DrewP.S. Complete health means feeling happy and centered even when the â€œstuffâ€ hits the fan. Dr. Nandiâ€™s >>Calming the Chaos Meditation Series is perhaps the quickest way to have peaceof mind within minutes, no matter whatâ€™s going on in your life.And you can try it right now.Itâ€™s free, so what have you got to lose?Besides your stress? subject: a personal story
full_text: If you are having trouble viewing this email, click here. Hey there! Now that you've been with us for a few days, I should probably formally introduce myself, huh? :) My name is Dave, I live in Los Angeles, California, and I run Paleohacks.com. I'm super passionate about Paleo because it has dramatically improved my life. Up until 5Â years ago, I was always fatigued, depressed, couldn't sleep, and couldn't focus. For the longest time I was told that how I felt was "normal" - most people had one or two of these issues, and you just needed to take some pill to fix it. For a while, I bought into it - I thought that this was just...Â how life was. Being tired and depressed all the time was justÂ part of the gameÂ - and if you didn't have these problems, you were just 'lucky'. A few years ago, I moved across the country from Connecticut to San Diego, and was introduced to the Paleo Diet by my roommate. The idea of eating just meat, fruits, and vegetables sounded great to me - so I dove right in. At the same time, my next door neighbor happened to be Sean Croxton - a natural health practitioner, and all around awesome guy. Sean ran some tests on me, and lo' and behold - there were some SERIOUS problems going on inside of my body. My symptoms weren't just my body's 'normal' state - I had stage 3 adrenal fatigue, leaky gut, and serious dysbiosis. Put more simply - my testosterone was lower than my mom's, I had all sorts of bad bacteria in my gut, and I was barely digesting my food. Fast forward now - 3 years later into the Paleo diet (and a little bit of supplementation along the way)... Myy testosterone has dramatically increased. I have more energy than I could have EVER imagined growing up... My mind is (almost!) like a steel trap... I RARELY have issues sleeping... And I'm leaner than I've ever been. To say that I am happier now would be a serious understatement. The change was like night and day. I feel like a complete person - and am able to function at a level I never could in the past. All this is to give you the reason why I created all of the resources here at Paleohacks for you -- including this cookbook and ourÂ Paleo For Beginners free program -- I want help make your transition into eating Paleo as easy as possible so you can start experiencing the benefits - more energy, fat loss, clearer skin, more focus, and so, SO much more that would make this e-mail way too long. :) So, with that said -- if you haven't taken a look at our bonus Paleo For Beginners guide, check it out here: Download Your Paleo For Beginners Guide Here And for more important (and free!) health resources from the blog, see below: 1. The Complete Paleo Diet Food List 2. The 16 Biggest Benefits of The Paleo Diet 3. Your First 48 Hours Paleo: 5 Things You Need To Know For a complete list of our best resources, check out our Paleo Diet 101 page. Youâ€™ve made the right decision by joining our community.Â Youâ€™re not far off from feeling better than you ever have! Just stick with us and we'll guide you across the finish line. :) Talk soon, Dave ----> BRAND NEW Cookbook: The Paleo Breakfast Bible! subject: The #1 way to handle HATERS
full_text: If you are having trouble viewing this email, click here. Hey there! I'm coming at you today from the warmth of Palm Desert, and before I head to the pool for the rest of the day, I wanted to share with you a fantastic story and some amazing life advice from a mentor of mine. This advice has helped me in my journey to not only become a healthier person, but a happier and more successful one as well. And it comes in the form of a story of a trip to Alaska... Enjoy! ------------------------------------------------------------------------ "How To Remove CRABS From Your Life" By Bedros Keuilian Several years ago while on an adventure trip to Alaska I experienced what I can only call one of life's greatest lessons. Like all great lessons in life, it came unexpected and it came to me exactly at the time when I needed it the most. While taking a walk along the shoreline in Ketchikan, Alaska I noticed several crab fisherman casting their nets, waiting a few moments, and the pulling in couple crabs at a time. One fisherman had a bucketful of five or six crabs in it. It was probably one of those five gallon paint buckets that you'd find at the local Home Depot. There was several inches of water at the bottom of the bucket and these crabs - some the size of my palm, and others the size of Shaquille O'neal's. As I stood there watching how this crab fisherman went about his trade I noticed that one of his crabs from the bucket was climbing on top of the rest. I couldn't really make out exactly what the crab was up to just yet, but I could tell this one was the more ambitious crabs of the bunch. But I soon figured out exactly what he was up to. This little ambitious crab was attempting to make a getaway! He was climbing on top of the others to gain height, then he slowly extend him front legs upward toward the lip of the bucket to pull himself up. HOLY COW!... this little guy was trying to make a break for it. FREEDOM! More out of curiosity than anything else I asked the crab fisherman if he was aware that this crab was about to hoist himself up and over the edge of the bucket. He calmly said; "watch what happens." As this ambitious crab started pulling himself up to get over the edge of the bucket, all of the other crabs reached up, grabbed his hind legs and pulled him down to the bottom of the bucket. LIFE LESSON! I instantly realized that I had made one of the dumbest mistakes of my life. Earlier that year I had figured out that a few of the people in my life were negative minded individuals who always found a way to squash my dreams each time I'd share it with them. Yet I continued to hang out with them, I kept them in my circle of influence, and shared my most lofty goals with them - only to have my ambitions squashed by their negativity, doubt, and scarcity mindedness. I wanted so badly to soar with the eagles, yet I was hanging out with turkeys. I suppose it was just comfortable to be around the people I knew, even if they did stunt my personal and professional growth, rather than to find a new circle of influence who would support me, challenge me, and encourage me to achieve and surpass my goals. Fear of the unknown stopped me from achieving my dreams sooner. But things changed for me after that day in Ketchikan, Alaska. When I got back home I committed to creating my "bubble" and cutting out all of the crabs and turkeys in my life. I become the gatekeeper of my bubble. I chose who got in and who got kicked out. It wasn't easy to do, but I cut ties with the crabs in my life. No more crabs, no more turkeys... ONLY eagles are allowed into my bubble these days. We've all heard the saying... you are the average of the five people who you surround yourself with the most. But you can also say it this way; your head space, your personal development, your attitude, your contribution to society, your personal and spiritual growth in life are all an average of the five people that you surround yourself the most. If the people in your circle of influence are crabs, energy vampires, and low tone then that's the effect that they're going to have on your life. If the people in your circle are positive, encourage you, support you, inspire you, then there is absolutely no limits on what you can achieve - really. That's what I want for you. You're an eagle, but you'll never soar as high as you can if you hang around with turkeys and crabs. Put yourself around the people who will support, encourage and challenge you to get to your goals. ------------------------------------------------------------------ I NEVER had more opposition in my life than when I became an entrepreneur, changed my diet, and started taking care of my health. It quickly became very clear to me who were really my friends and supporters, and who just wanted me to stay the same -- so that they could be comfortable with their own failings and insecurities. You better believe those people are no longer a part of my life. And I am a MUCH better, happier, less-stressed person for it. And if you have people like that in your life, that are draining you, holding you back, then one of the most important things you can do is remove them - immediately. This life is not a test run - there are no redos. Every second you spend wasted with negative, toxic people is one that you will NEVER get back. Remember that! And think about replacing those negative people with ones who actually inspire and support you -- starting today. Talk soon, Dave P.S. If you enjoyed this story,Â it's posted on Facebook here for easy sharing. ----> BRAND NEW Cookbook: The Paleo Breakfast Bible! Get our hot-off-the-press Breakfast Cookbook today and get everything you need to: - Enjoy a variety of delicious, QUICK Paleo Breakfast Recipes (10 minutes or less!) - Give yourself an energy jump-start in the morning with Paleo alternatives to bagels, muffins, and pancakes - NOT be stuck eating eggs and bacon everyday - try our apple bread, zesty lemon scones, BBQ chicken egg muffins, and more... With over 100 delicious breakfast recipes at your disposal, you'll never run out of tasty morning meals! Get your copy here. This newsletter is meant ONLY for people who have positive energy, who take personal responsibility, and who want to help themselves (and others) get healthy and become the best versions of themselves. If that isn't you, you can unsubscribe. We won't hold it against you. subject: Can't Smell THIS? *Alzheimer's Sign*
full_text: HiÂ Dorothy, it's David Andrews here... A breakthrough study at The University of Florida has unearthed a shocking link between smell, and the onset of Alzheimerâ€™s. In fact, if youâ€™re unable to smell THIS particular food.... ....thereâ€™s a 93% chance that youâ€™re suffering from early stage Alzheimerâ€™s disease. This food is probably sitting in your kitchen cupboard right now, so itâ€™s an easy test to do. Go right here to find out if youâ€™re showing the early signs of Alzheimerâ€™s. When you watch the video, you will also discover a weird â€˜at homeâ€™ trick proven to reverse Alzheimerâ€™s, boost brain health, and improve memory, focus and concentration. And you wonâ€™t believe how simple it is. Discover the simple trick that boosts brain power, right here. To health and healing, David Andrews ___________________________________ FEATURED COLUMN: Lifestyle Check-Up: Are You Making These Critical Errors? Hi Dorothy, it's David Andrews... Hope you are doing well today. In this newsletter, weâ€™re going to discuss some key lifestyle modifications that you may need to make as you are recovering from diabetes. Diabetes is unfortunately a condition that you must be mindful of 24/7 as nearly everything you do can influence how you feel. If you arenâ€™t being careful, you can end up experiencing a great deal of complications. Fortunately, there are a few simple changes that will get you on track and keep you there. Letâ€™s look at a few of the top lifestyle modifications to know about. Walk As Often As Possible As the saying goes, a body in motion stays in motion. The last thing you want to do is become sedentary for hours on end. No matter how much work you have to get done for instance at your day job, still take the time to get up every hour and walk around for two to three minutes. This is one of the best things that you can do to help keep your blood sugar levels in check and to also promote overall better health as well. Studies have shown that those who sit for hours on end each day are at a higher risk of both heart disease as well as early mortality. Then once your work hours are over, also make an effort to head outside and walk for 10-15 minutes per day at minimum. Walking is the best form of exercise, itâ€™s easy, and itâ€™s free. Thereâ€™s no excuse not to get it in. Catch Some Sleep Itâ€™s time to start prioritizing your sleep. When youâ€™re sleeping well, youâ€™ll feel better overall and youâ€™ll have better control over your blood sugar levels. If you want to make life easier on yourself, sleep must be a top thing on your to-do list. Too many adults are trying to get by on six hours of sleep when the human body really needs seven to nine hours depending on the person. If you ever feel like you could dose off in the middle of the day, thatâ€™s a clear sign that you arenâ€™t getting enough sleep. And, your health and bodyweight may be suffering. Those who donâ€™t sleep enough typically have higher BMIâ€™s than those who do. Remember that next time youâ€™re thinking about staying up to watch late night television. Check Your Blood Sugar, Cholesterol, and Triglycerides Regularly While everyone should be having these tests performed on a regular basis as part of their overall general health check-up, for you with diabetes, they are even more important. Keeping tabs on these numbers and ensuring they are at safe and healthy levels is a must if you are to prevent future diabetes related complications in the future. Book an appointment to get these numbers checked every few months at minimum. Speak to your doctor about it as well as depending on the severity of your condition, he or she may want you to check them more regularly. Make Friends With a Food Tracker Finally, the last lifestyle change that you need to make as you go about living with diabetes is to ensure that you are constantly using a food tracker on a regular basis. Find a good one that you are comfortable using and that doesnâ€™t feel too much like a nuisance and then put it to use. It may only take 10 minutes or so extra each day to track your food, but this 10 minutes can make the biggest difference when it comes to your bodyweight and health. A food tracker will allow you to see exactly how many calories and grams of both carbs and sugar you are taking in, so you can keep close tabs on both these numbers very easily. So there you have a few of the top lifestyle changes that you should consider making as you go about your weeks. Are you missing out on any of these? If so, itâ€™s time that you started adding them into the picture. Click reply to let me know! Would LOVE to hear from you. -David Andrews If you wish to stop receiving our emails or change your subscription options, please Manage Your SubscriptionSparkHealth Media , PO Box 303043, North Harbor, North Shore, Auckland 0751

subject: The Common Bathroom Habit that CAUSES Hearing Loss
full_text: HiÂ Dorothy it's David Andrews here... You wake up in the morning. Brush your teeth. And then you do THIS. Could this everyday bathroom habit be KILLING your hearing? That's exactly what Harvard Medical School has concluded in a recent study. In fact, doing this just twice a week was shown to increase hearing loss by up to 24%. The worst part is, you could be doing this multiple times a week, or even EVERY DAY. So what is this common bathroom habit thatâ€™s such a danger to your hearing, and what can you do to reverse it? Watch this short video to find out. To health and healing, David Andrews Creator of Diabetes Destroyer FEATURED COLUMN: 3 Benefits Of Yoga For Optimizing Blood Sugar Levels Hi it's David here... Looking for something new to try in the gym? As someone who is attempting to manage their blood glucose levels, exercise is a must. When you exercise, you use up blood glucose residing in the body as well as stored muscle glycogen, which then creates more storage for any incoming carbohydrates you use. All in all, exercise simply makes managing your diabetic condition that much easier. Now, most people turn to intense physical activity as a way to manage their symptoms â€“ interval training sprints or weight lifting. And while both of these are certainly helpful for those who are suffering, there is another exercise variety that you may want to add to the mix. That exercise? Yoga. Too many people overlook yoga and miss out on all the potential benefits that it has to offer. If you want to see optimal results from your workouts however, yoga is one exercise youâ€™ll want to be considering. What benefits does it have to offer? Letâ€™s take a closer look. Improved Insulin Sensitivity The first great benefit youâ€™ll get from taking part in yoga is improved insulin sensitivity levels. This is important for anyone who is suffering from diabetes as the more sensitive your body is to insulin, the better able youâ€™ll be to handle the carbohydrates that you consume. Insulin resistance is one of the hallmark traits of those who are suffering from diabetes, so the more steps you can take to avoid this, the better. Decreased Stress The next key benefit that yoga has to offer is a lower overall stress level. Stress can wreak havoc with your blood sugar levels. If you are highly stressed, your body is going to be secreting a great deal of cortisol, which is what will then cause sugar to move into the blood stream for a source of quick energy if needed. If you arenâ€™t using this energy, it will then get re-deposited back on your body as body fat stores. The end result is weight gain you and potentially worsening your symptoms as a diabetic. High stress lifestyles and diabetes do not go hand in hand, so doing anything you can to lower your stress will be helpful. As yoga focuses on tuning into your breathing and shutting out distractions, it can go a long way towards restoring your peaceful state of mind. Enhanced Sleep Quality Finally, the last benefit that yoga has to offer is improved sleep quality. Sleep is another must for optimal results managing your diabetes as sleep not only helps you better control your appetite, thus preventing weight gain, but in addition to that, it also helps ensure that you regulate insulin sensitivity as well. Those who are chronically sleep deprived tend to have far greater levels of insulin resistance and therefore, this is what only aggravates their symptoms. Those who partake in yoga on a regular basis tend to not only fall asleep faster, but sleep deeper in the hours they are sleeping. As a result, they awaken each morning feeling refreshed and rejuvenated. So there you have the three main reasons to consider getting involved in yoga today. You donâ€™t have to devote a huge amount of time to this training either to see great results. Just 1-3 sessions per week even for just 20 minutes if you prefer can offer you great benefits. You donâ€™t even have to leave your house to do yoga. Here is a quick and easy sequence you can do in the comfort of your own home with a yoga mat. Mountain Pose â€“ Hold for 5 breaths Downward Dog â€“ Hold for 3 breaths Warrior Pose â€“ Hold for 1 minute per side Tree Pose â€“ Hold for 30 seconds per side Triangle Pose â€“ Hold for 3 breaths per side Talk to you soon! -David Andrews If you wish to stop receiving our emails or change your subscription options, please Manage Your SubscriptionSparkHealth Media , PO Box 303043, North Harbor, North Shore, Auckland 0751

subject: How a Car Works - End of summer update
full_text: Hi Lorem I've written a longer blog post on my progress on the video course over the last few weeks. You can read the post which has videos and links that you'll like, but here's a summary: We've created the 95% of the car in 3D. It took four guys six weeks but the detail is awesome and there's going to be no better way to quickly understand all the mechanics in a car. 3D models are ready to explore in your browser or on your phone. I've put the differential and the engine online for now. Script is almost ready and we start filming again next week for the real meat of this series. I hope to have more videos out to you by the end of the summer. And if you didn't already see it, you're going to love this stop motion animation we made of dismantling the engine. Share it on Facebook - I'd appreciate it! I'm writing this from Lagos in Portugal, where I've taken a few days holiday (my first since January). Back to Budapest on Saturday and we're right back into it. Do check out the blog post - it's much more interesting than this email!! All the best, Alex Read the update at Video Course: Summer update Check the 3D engine Three clicks to stay in touch :) â Subscribe on Youtube â Like us on Facebook â Follow us on Twitter How a Car Works is produced with â¤ by me, Alex Muir. You might want to follow me personally on Twitter at @alexmuir. How a Car Works, Unit 2, 6 North Isla Street, Dundee, United Kingdom, DD3 7JQ www.howacarworks.com.

subject: How a Car Works - November update
full_text: Hi Lorem It's been far too long since I updated you on the course. So here's where we are at... the 3D modeling is complete. The whole car is made, and it's already working out because I can use the 3D models to make illustrations very quickly. You can hear me talk about the progress on the video course by watching this video (starting at 28:03) Noise Two things are holding me up at the moment. One is noise - when I started this project the garage was quiet but within a few weeks a huge construction project started across the road and it's become worse and worse. Relocating isn't really an option because we've set up lighting and sound, not to mention the car lift. Last week we couldn't film at all, so I spent the day soundproofing a whole wall which has made a big difference. We actually filmed this day so if you've got 40 minutes to spare and you're wondering what the hell I'm up to over here, then head on over to Vimeo to watch it. (but be warned, it's quite random!). Style The second issue is one of style. Our first section on dismantling the car had a relaxed style, nice and light and, hopefully, easy to watch and also informative. The second part, where I want to explain all the parts is more difficult. We've recorded three times now in different styles: First I tried freestyling where I basically just make it up as I go along. This has worked pretty well up to now, but when it came time to edit I realized that I'd missed out covering vital things. Or called things by the wrong names. It was also nearly impossible to plan shots or for the camera guy to know how to set up for lighting. So I moved onto... ...a script. I wrote a word-for-word script, learned it and we worked off this. This produced informative and informationally correct videos, but it feels to rigid to me. You can watch a test edit of this here if you're interested - there's also good CGI examples there. finally I've settled on a different workflow. I write a very detailed article on each component before we talk about it, I then make a bullet point of important things to cover and riff off this. It's working really well and we're back in the flow now. You get the articles And since I'm writing the articles, you get access to them before anyone else. I'll publish them on the site as soon as I've written them. They might be a little rough but I'm sure you can pick up a lot of useful information from them even before we get the video edited and out to you. I just finished the article on the engine block. ETA We'll have the engine rebuilt in three weeks, and the rest of the car in another three weeks. There will be more videos released at the start of December. The whole course will be rough cut by the end of January and compeletely finished in February. And along the way we'll make the best articles and the best diagrams of all the parts. Have a good week. I'm going to try to update you more often from here on! All the best and as always I welcome your feedback, Alex Read about the engine block Three clicks to stay in touch :) â Subscribe on Youtube â Like us on Facebook â Follow us on Twitter How a Car Works is produced with â¤ by me, Alex Muir. You might want to follow me personally on Twitter at @alexmuir. How a Car Works, Unit 2, 6 North Isla Street, Dundee, United Kingdom, DD3 7JQ www.howacarworks.com.

subject: New videos now available
full_text: Hi Lorem Finally, after what feels like an enormously long time, I've got new videos for you! And these videos are detailed. Reassembling the car starts with the engine, and videos on the engine block and the crankshaft are available now, the pistons episode is being edited and I'm hopeful we can have that out to you this weekend. I'm happy with the style and the content, so we should be flying along now! CGI is coming but I think the videos are mostly clear enough without it so I'd rather get them out to you than wait any longer! But wait... there's more! For each episode we've also got articles for you to read, along with beautiful new illustrations. You'll find articles on: The engine block The crankshaft and the pistons (still needs some illustrations) Android app The Android app is now available in the Google Play store. It's free, just like the iOS app. There's no augmented reality views in the Android app at the moment but it is on my radar. If you've preordered the course then you should be able to sign into the Android app and watch it there. If you're on iOS then you'll find our free iOS app in the AppStore. Other news A handful of people received multiple emails from me last week - I'm sorry. I've rewritten the mailing system completely so this should be solved. Also, you can now unsubscribe by clicking the link below if you aren't interested in my ramblings. A new engine teardown Hopefully you remember my retro engine teardown. Well... I'm going to shoot another one over a few days in March - Tweet me your suggestions for what engine I should do. Next episodes will be on the pistons, head gasket and cylinder head. Also tools episodes for how to use a torque wrench and feeler gauges. And don't forget - you're a preorder customer which means you get full rights to tell me when I've made mistakes or can improve things. All the best, Alex Want to unsubscribe? No worries, just click here. subject: Meet Famous Irish Whiskey Named After the Underdog Winning Horse
full_text: The world's greatest spirits await inside. View in Browser Get $10! Invite a Friend SPIRITS CLUBS GIFT CARDS PRIVATE CASK CONCIERGE Tyrconnell 16 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey SALE ENDS IN COOLEY DISTILLERY Tyrconnell 16 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey In 1876, the family of Andrew Watt entered a horse named "The Tyrconnell" in an Irish horse race known as the The National Produce Stakes. Despite the 100-to-1 odds against him, Tyrconnell won the race and the Watt family, which had been producing whiskey since 1762, celebrated by launching the Tyrconnell label. "The development of this whiskey is beautiful." Adventures in Whiskey â€œWhen looking for a new single malt expression to raise the bar for Irish whiskey, we knew right away that The Tyrconnell 16 Year Old would showcase the magic of the brandâ€™s signature double distillation and expertise in aging, providing fans with a rich, complex spirit.â€ John Cashman, Global Brand Ambassador TAKE ME THERE Suntory Hibiki Japanese Harmony Whisky SUNTORY DISTILLERY Suntory Hibiki Japanese Harmony Whisky This new whisky, which is expertly blended from 12 unique grain and malt whiskies produced at the Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita distilleries in Japan, was named the Japanese Whisky of the Year by Whisky Advocate in December. The blend, which was developed by master blender Shingo Torii and chief blender Shinji Fukuyo, is composed of five key styles - Chita grain whiskey, which serves as the â€œbrothâ€, malt whiskies aged in American oak casks, sherry casks and Mizunara (Japanese Oak) casks, and finally a smoky malt whisky which adds hidden complexity to the whisky. "Japanese Whisky of the Year. Itâ€™s a master class in blending. Itâ€™s also a master class in how great non-age statement whisky should be." Whisky Advocate "Rather beautiful on the inside and out." Miss Whisky TAKE ME THERE FEW + Flaming Lips Brainville Rye Whiskey FEW DISTILLERY FEW + Flaming Lips Brainville Rye Whiskey Like Fewâ€™s award winning rye, this limited release is distilled in Chicago from a mash of 70% Wisconsin rye, 20% Indiana corn and 10% Wisconsin barley. After aging the rye, Hletko and his team of distillers fill each bottle by hand and affix an artistic label inspired by the psychedelic rock group, the Flaming Lips & designed by music industry designer Justin Helton. This is a limited release of 5,000 bottles - try one today! â€œWhiskeyâ€¦ itâ€™s such a volatile drink. Upon pouring a drink Itâ€™s like accepting that you may become a warewolf â€¦ And reallyâ€¦ Who doesnâ€™t want to become a werewolf ???â€ Wayne Coyne - Flaming Lips frontman TAKE ME THERE The Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask Single Malt Scotch Whisky SALE ENDS IN BALVENIE DISTILLERY The Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask Single Malt Scotch Whisky Aged for a minimum of 14 years, The Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask Single Malt Scotch Whisky is finished in casks that were previously used to mature Caribbean rum. â€œDouble Gold Medal.â€ San Francisco World Spirits Competition â€œA new addition to the permanent Balvenie range. Lovely bright gold color. Great viscosity with good grip on the finish. I really like the balance in this whisky â€” nice complexity too! A very solid effort and the price is right.â€ San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2008 TAKE ME THERE Absolut Elyx Single Estate Handcrafted Vodka SALE ENDS IN Absolut Absolut Elyx Single Estate Handcrafted Vodka Absolut Elyx is a new definition of luxury vodka, built on the principles of quality, integrity and true craftsmanship. Every drop of Absolut Elyx is made with soft winter wheat from a Single estate, Rabelof, in Southern Sweden. The wheat is then manually distilled in a vintage copper column still from 1921. The result is an award winning vodka with a rich and exceptionally smooth mouth feel. Absolut Elyx has partnered with Water For People in their mission to provide sustainable water solutions where they are needed most. For every bottle of Elyx sold, we're donating a week's supply of safe water (140 liters) to those in need of it. Cocktail Enthusiast TAKE ME THERE The Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak Scotch Single Malt SALE ENDS IN THE MACALLAN The Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak Scotch Single Malt The Macallan distillers remove the heads and tails of the whisky and collect approximately 16% of the spirit to fill into casks for maturation, which is among the highest of any Scottish distillery. This cut yields a more full-bodied and rich whisky. This 10-year-old whisky is a lighter take on the Macallan. Matured for 10 years in a balance of Bourbon & Sherry Oak casks. â€œThe breadth, depth, and sophistication of the Macallan Fine Oak Range is simply jaw-droppingly good.â€ Jim Murray, Whisky Expert TAKE ME THERE Casamigos AÃ±ejo Tequila SALE ENDS IN PRODUCTOS FINOS DE AGAVE Casamigos AÃ±ejo Tequila Lorem Clooney and Rande Gerber have turned out to be quite the tequila makers. Crafted using agave from the Jalisco Highlands, this AÃ±ejo has refined highly nuanced flavors, and as the founders put it â€œwon't burn going down,â€ or â€œgive you a hangoverâ€ in the morning. The duo have succeeded in crafted a solid AÃ±ejo with an â€œon the rocksâ€ character. Bottled at a solid 40% ABV this Casamigos AÃ±ejo has sophisticated notes of oak and spice, with a hint of agave for good measure. "As you do in Mexico, we would drink a lot of tequila. We'd go out to bars and restaurants and bartenders would recommend them. Some were good, some not so good, and some expensive. There came a point where Lorem turned to me and said, 'Why don't we create one that's perfect for us? We wanted one that didn't burn going down, that was super smooth, and had the right flavor profile. One that we didn't have to mix â€” typically we drink it straight or on the rocks â€“ that we could drink all day long and not be hungover in the morning.â€ Rande Gerber TAKE ME THERE Glencadam Origin 1825 Single Malt Scotch Whisky SALE ENDS IN GLENCADAM DISTILLERY Glencadam Origin 1825 Single Malt Scotch Whisky Glencadam Origin 1825 is the first NAS (non age statement) whisky to be released by Glencadam. First launched in 2016 this single malt was matured American-white-oak bourbon barrels, then finished in oloroso-sherry butts. Produced with distinctly upward sloped lyne arms on the stills, Glencadam whiskies have a distinctly floral, pear-drop element to the whisky. This Highland spirit is teeming with notes of fruit and flowers. This single malt has a lower ABV making it a smooth drink, not overly complex, a perfect starter whisky for aspiring novices! Youâ€™ll find yourself craving less food and feeling more full now that your body is running on fat at 250% more efficiency than carbs. Kegenix pays for itself. Umm....What? That's right!Â Kegenix products by Real Ketones are basically free if you use them properly. According to a recent survey in the New York Times the average meal in America is around $7. If you are using Kegenix PRIME in the morning you can skip breakfast and still feel fulfilled and full of energy, ifÂ you are using Kegenix Meal Replacement you can skip lunch, and if you add Keto Vital Vitamins into the mix you can rest assured knowing that you are getting all of the vitamins and minerals your body needs to stay healthy. We are not saying that you should empty your pantry and fill it full of Kegenix (although you could :) What we are saying is that Kegenix products will help you replace meals when it is convenient for you. With diseases like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's now reaching the highest levels in history your brain will thank you for feeding it ketones and reward you with better focus and a healthier life. subject: KETO VITAL IS BACK!
full_text: Keto Vital is back in stock | Cauliflower Grilled Cheese | Letter from David Diamond WHAT'S NEW WITHÂ REAL KETONES? Keto Vital is BACK IN STOCK! And will be available for purchase on Amazon soon. Buy Now BrandÂ NEWÂ Facebook Community We are determined to help you successfully transition to a ketogenic lifestyle. And we realize that having a support system isÂ crucial.Â So,Â we have created a Facebook groupÂ specifically to support you along the way. You can expect to find; Tips from fellow exogenous ketones users Inspirational transformations Ketogenic diet recipes A first look at all up-coming deals Click belowÂ to join, and beÂ a partÂ of our ketogenic family! Click Here Fall is here, and it has us craving chunky-knitÂ sweaters, warm drinks, and pumpkin patches. It also has us craving CARBS! But you have worked so hard to get into ketosis, and we are not going to let you throw that all away! One of myÂ all-timeÂ favorite comfort foods as a kidÂ wasÂ grilled cheese sandwiches. But now, they leave me with a gut-bomb, and the inevitable insulin spike/crash. This recipe contains no bread, andÂ is packed with delicious seasonings and two different kinds of cheese. Give it a try the next time you are looking for something to warm you up after an evening of raking leaves. Click Here How Did We Get It So Wrong About What to Eat? David Diamond, PhD. in Cognitive and Neural Sciences Until I was 40 years of age there are some things about diet and health that I was certain were proven facts. Everyone knew that being a vegetarian was healthier than being a meat eater. Despite the well-established benefits of being a vegetarian, I remember making the decision that I would rather die young eating meat than to suffer through a long life deprived of bacon and eggs for breakfast and a cheeseburger for lunch. I felt like I was inviting a heart attack to dinner every time I ate a steak. It seemed like it was only a matter of time before the Surgeon General would impose a warning label on beef packages at the supermarket: â€œCaution: Consumption of this most tasty food will raise your cholesterol levels, clog your arteries and cause you to have a heart attack or strokeâ€. When I turned 40, the fictitious Surgeon Generalâ€™s warning became a reality for me. After a lifetime of cheeseburgers, French fries, ice cream and soda, I was fat (20 pounds overweight), and even worse, my cholesterol and triglycerides were dangerously high. I figured I could battle against my excess weight and high cholesterol with a low fat diet and hold off on taking any medication. For the next 10 years, I exercised 3-4 days a week and followed a low fat diet. I switched to skim milk, low fat yogurt, low fat ice cream, bread and potatoes without butter, and lean meat. With each annual blood test and each time I stepped on the bathroom scale I was disappointed. At the end of this decade of low fat dieting all I had to show was that my blood lipids persisted at frightening high levels and I gained another 10 pounds. At this point my doctor began to urge me to take his warnings more seriously. There had been no heart disease in my family, but perhaps I would be the first one to have a heart attack. Although I had a PhD in biology, my training had been in the study of the brain and memory, not heart disease. I therefore decided that before I took any medication I should put my training in biology to action. I expected that I would read a few medical papers which would confirm that, along with my low fat diet, statins would be the ideal treatment for me to lower my risk of a heart attack. After I read a few papers, I then read a few hundred more, and I was amazed at what I had found. How was it possible that almost everything I had been told by sources I had trusted, such as the American Heart Association, regarding the so-called benefits of a low fat diet and my fear of high levels of serum cholesterol, was wrong? In the past decade I have amassed a library of over a thousand medical papers on diet and health. Iâ€™ve also had the great pleasure to learn of the great benefits of the ketogenic diet from scholars, such as Jeff Volek and Dom Dâ€™Agostino. Iâ€™ve gotten my weight under control and I know which blood lipids I need to fear (and itâ€™s not cholesterol). In my next installment Iâ€™ll share with the readers what Iâ€™ve learned about misinformation and deception in health advice, including the systematic demonization of low carbohydrate diets, and Iâ€™ll cover the real risk factors for heart disease. Have a great day! The Real Ketones Team Copyright Â© 2017 Real Ketones, All rights reserved. You are receiving this email as a customer of Real Ketones. subject: BRAND NEW PRODUCT! Kegenix IGNITE
full_text: Don't miss out on your opportunity for a discount! You won't see this discount anywhere else! Introducing Kegenix IGNITE Kegenix IGNITE is the first of its kind in the exogenous ketone market. This spray was created in response to our customers' four most frequently asked questions. 1. What should I take PRE/POST WORKOUT? IGNITE combines ketones, caffeine, and AAKG (known for its ability to increase nitric oxide production) with glucuronolactone to help INCREASE STRENGTH AND LEAN MUSCLE GAINS while inhibiting the synthesis of toxic by-products and REDUCING FATIGUE. 2. How can I ENHANCE MY MOOD? When ketones are combined with N Acetyl L Tyrosine (NALT), a rapidly absorbed and highly bioavailable form of L Tyrosine can provide some amazing mood calming effects. This is because the combination of ketones and NALT influence adrenaline and dopamine in the brain in order to reduce stress and mental agitation. 3. How can I curb my CARB CRAVINGS? Ketones are well known for their ability to SUPPRESS APPETITE AND CARB CRAVINGS because they work to suppress ghrelin, the hunger hormone. As you go through the day, you may experience a time when you feel a little hungry. IGNITE is designed to deliver CRAVE-FREEING ENERGY to get you past those points of hunger or cravings. 4. How can I SHARPEN MY MENTAL FOCUS? The term "brain fog" is often used to describe a lack-of-focus, poor memory, lapses in cognition, etc. What science has found is this "brain fog" can be caused by having very little GABA and way too much glutamate. This can happen when the brain is overrun by glucose or becomes insensitive to glucose utilization. As a result, the brain suddenly can't process all of the energy it needs, leaving you "foggy". Ketones and a ketogenic diet appear to replace the energy and reduce the damaging effect of excess glucose to the brain. This can increase the GABA and its ability to resume being the powerful neurotransmitter it is. This relieves the brain of its stress, and helps it become MORE ALERT. Now, add the natural metabolites of caffeine and glucuronolactone, along with IGNITE'S ketones, and you get that MENTAL LIFT AND PERFORMANCE that people report as "my brain fog was suddenly lifted." subject: Welcome to Brighton.com
full_text: We're so glad you've created an account on Brighton.com. View this email as a webpage Visit Brighton.com Hello valued Brighton customer, Thank you for signing up for an account and to receive our emails! Now your online shopping will be easier and faster because there is so much more that you can do! Create and share your wishlist to help family and friends choose perfect gifts. Track your order and see when you'll receive it. View your order history whenever you like. Share your opinions about products. Be the first to hear about our promotions. Get invited to special events. Don't you just love the little things that make life run more smoothly? We do! We also love it when you shop in little boutiques across the country where you can get to see and hear all about Brighton, feel the fine quality leathers, see the intricate details and craftsmanship and enjoy terrific service. Of course, when you do want to shop online or call us on the phone, we're here for you. You can reach us toll-free at (800) 628-7687 Monday-Friday 7:00am - 5:00pm PST. Or, you may email us at consumercare@brighton.com. Whatever way you want to shop for Brighton, we're happy to help! subject: 6 tips to improve your VPN speed
full_text: Problems displaying this e-mail? Open it in a browser Dear NordVPN user, All the extra security of a VPN may contribute to some Internet speed loss. However, if you have noticed slower performance than usual, you might be able to fix it by following these tips: 1.Â Check your internet speeds without the VPN. 2.Â Tinker with the Internet protocols - you can switch between UDP and TCP on your NordVPN apps. 3.Â Sometimes your router/modem may slow down your VPN speeds because of memory leaks. We suggest the good old router restart. 4.Â Try to choose another VPN server. Proximity and server load might affect your Internet speeds - you can always select a different server from the long list on your NordVPN application. 5.Â Try a wired connection to your network, as Wi-Fi connection can be slower. 6.Â Last but not least, your computer or device may just be tired. Restart it. This is another old trick, but it could help increase the VPN speed and get you back to enjoying your content. We hope these tricks will help make your VPN connection considerably faster. If you run into any unexpected errors or wish to troubleshoot something - pleaseÃ¢â‚¬â€¹ contact our tech support. Best, Ignacio NordVPN support team Questions? subject: Guide to ultimate privacy and security
full_text: Problems displaying this e-mail? Open it in a browser Dear NordVPN user, You must be well under your way of mastering the art of Internet privacy. Here are a few additional tips NordVPN has compiled: a handful of important tools and techniques that you can use to increase your security beyond VPN. Delete or disable cookies. Third-party cookies are among the most common methods that advertisers use to track your browsing habits. Every major browser offers the option to disable cookies. You can also use a tool likeÂ Wipe to remove cookies after each session. Block trackers. If you hate the idea of being spied on by advertisers, consider installing a tracker blocker like Ghostery or Privacy Badger. Block location data. In recent years, many websites have started using location data to offer specific services and display targeted ads. Any major browser should allow you to switch location data on and off, and we recommend leaving it off completely. Use secure email. The popular email providers such as Gmail, Outlook and Yahoo do not offer a completely secure environment to send and receive emails. If you want to avoid email scanning and Yahoo-style data breaches, consider ProtonMail. It encrypts emails end-to-end, which means it is impossible to intercept and decipher them. Stay safe! Best, Ignacio NordVPN support team Questions? subject: From farm to jacket: Our commitment to the Responsible Down Standard.
full_text: Stay warm and protected. Shop Now Â» | ViewÂ OnlineÂ Â» Columbia Men Women Kids Footwear Sale Responsible Down Standard certified. WITH GREAT WARMTHCOMES GREAT RESPONSIBILITY At Columbia, we are committed to certifying our down-insulated products to the Responsible Down Standard (RDS), a certification that recognizes best practices in animal welfare and verifies responsible sourcing across our supply chain â€“ from farm to finished product. A woman cups a tuft of responsibly down in her two hands. WHAT IS THE RESPONSIBLE DOWN STANDARD? The RDS is an independent, voluntary global standard. It was developed with input from animal welfare groups, industry experts, brands, and retailers and helps ensure the down and feathers used in our products are sourced responsibly. Screencap image for video about Columbiaâ€™s dedication to responsible down. Workers in protective gear sift through a tuft of down. QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE Our commitment to having RDS-certified down and feathers in our product line goes hand in hand with our dedication to producing the best gear for keeping you warm and protected while being active in the outdoors. Weâ€™re proud to offer a full range of responsible down products built for all kinds of activities in all kinds of weather. A dark blue with orange trim menâ€™s down jacket. subject: Our Directors of Toughness vs. the Avachinsky Volcano.
full_text: Check out Faith and Markâ€™s favorite gear. Shop Now Â» | ViewÂ OnlineÂ Â» Columbia Men Women Kids Footwear Sale Columbiaâ€™s Directors of Toughness, Faith Briggs and Mark Chase, climb over loose rock toward the summit of the Avachinsky volcano in Russiaâ€™s Kamchatka Peninsula. FROM RUSSIA WITH LAVA Faith Briggs and Mark Chase venture into the remote outer reaches of Russia to climb the active Avachinsky volcano in the first leg of their trip to the Kamchatka Peninsula. After summiting Mt. Shasta, Faith and Mark have their sights set on another peak in the Ring of Fire for their ninth challenge. Itâ€™s two steps forward, one step back as they fight up the steaming volcano amid washed-out trails, loose rock, and volatile weather. WATCH THE VIDEO SHOP TITANIUM Faith and Mark trek along a steep, snowy ridge on the Avachinsky volcano in Russia. AS I STOOD ABOVE THE CRATER PEERING DOWN, I COULDN'T HELP BUT FEEL THAT THIS MONSTER KNEW WE WERE THERE. The womenâ€™s Jacket of all Tradesâ„¢ was Faithâ€™s favorite gear. FAITHâ€™S FAVORITE GEAR Venturing from sea level to standing atop a volcano at 9,000 feet, Faith needed versatile layers and found them all with the three-in-one Jacket of all Tradesâ„¢, saying â€œYou can go hiking in it, you can hang out in the cityâ€¦itâ€™s one of my new favorites.â€ JACKET OF ALL TRADESâ„¢ See more of their favorite gear from this trip â€º The OutDry Extreme Eco Down Jacket was Markâ€™s favorite gear. MARKâ€™S FAVORITE GEAR Climbing high up an unpredictable mountain in volatile conditions puts a premium on staying warm, dry, and protected for whatever comes, which is why Mark turned to what he calls â€œan absolute game-changer,â€ the OutDryâ„¢ Extreme Eco Down Jacket. OUTDRYâ„¢ EX ECO DOWN JACKET See more of their favorite gear from this trip â€º Faith and Mark stand on an outcrop overlooking a lake and mountain valley below. INSIDE THE WORLD'S BEST WORST JOB. From swimming in a glacial lagoon in Iceland to warding off rattlesnakes in Death Valley, see where else Faith and Mark have been, what they've done, and what just another day at the office looks like for our Directors of Toughness. EXPLORE THE JOURNEY A portrait of Director of Toughness, Mark Chase. Follow Mark's adventures on Twitter and Instagram. A portrait of Director of Toughness, Faith Briggs. Follow Faith's adventures on Twitter and Instagram. subject: Have you tried every NYC spot on our list?
full_text: Postmate them all 5 NYC restaurants to know in 2018 There are spots around NYC you order from more than you call your own mother, and there are spots you havenâ€™t heard ofâ€”yet. Read on to see where these restaurants fall. Know them, love them, Postmate them. GET IT NOW by CHLOE. Vegan or not, by CHLOE.â€™s plant-based dishes have become a staple of NYC dining. We donâ€™t know how they do it (witchcraft?), but they have a way of making quinoa, kale, and kelp sound tantalizingly good and taste even better. The Meatball Shop From spicy pork balls to beef balls to chicken balls to veggie, weâ€™ve never said â€œballsâ€ so many times in one sentence. The Meatball Shop made us do itâ€”because their menu has items like sandwiches and salads, but the meatballs are so good weâ€™ve never wanted anything else. Black Seed You have your opinion about which NYC bagel spot is best, we have ours. Rolled by hand, boiled in honey water, and baked in a wood-fired oven, Black Seed bagels are the perfect foundation for any of their classic sandwiches. Jam packed with a range of delicious ingredients (lox, cream cheese, the works), thereâ€™s no elegant way to eat these. We donâ€™t mind. Joeâ€™s Shanghai Soup dumpling addicts, you know all about Joeâ€™s Shanghai. If you didnâ€™t know you could also get their famous made-to-order soup dumplings delivered via Postmates, well, now you do. Doughnut Plant Itâ€™s a New York institutionâ€”and a New Yearâ€™s resolution killer (sorry health nuts). If the tres leches cake doughnut or the creme brulee doughseed donâ€™t tempt you, we donâ€™t know what will. Hungry yet? subject: Open Me. Disney NYC Events Inside
full_text: Exciting New York Events You Don't Want to Miss! Frozen fans, admit it. You sing along shamelessly to the movie and soundtrack, and are warming up your vocals for the moment when Frozen comes to Broadway in Spring 2018. Well, brace yourselves, because Disney Theatrical Productions just released the first photos for the stage production, which is set to have more than twice as much music as the film. SHARE ON: Facebook Twitter The Ice Show Worth Melting For! Discover the full story of Disney's Frozen as Disney On Ice presents Frozen skates to your city! Hosted by Mickey and Minnie, delight in unforgettable music and special appearances by favorite Disney stars. Visit DisneyOnIce.com to learn more! Learn More Here's An Opportunity For You And A Guest Attend the world famous 91st Annual Macy's Thanksgiving Day ParadeÂ® on Thursday, Nov. 23 in Manhattan, New York*! View this spectacular event from the "best seats in the house," the grandstands near Herald Square, where you'll see Olaf as well as the other balloons, floats, marching bands and other performances firsthand. Learn More Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas - Live to Film! Danny Elfman will once again reprise his role as Jack Skellington, the melancholy Pumpkin King who longs to celebrate Christmas. The performances, scheduled for December 6 and 7 at 8 p.m. ET at Barclays Center in New York City. Get Tickets ALADDIN - THE MUSICAL Discover a whole new world at ALADDIN, the hit Broadway musical, now playing at the New Amsterdam Theatre. Get Tickets NYC PERKS FOR DISNEYÂ® VISAÂ® Cardmembers New York City truly has something for everyone! Learn more at the DisneyÂ® VisaÂ® Insider Cardmember blog where we've listed four great ways for a New York minute to last a Disney lover's lifetime. Learn More Item of the Day! If you're a holiday enthusiast, then hold your reindeer because today's Item of the Day shows you how to really get into the spirit. Read More GAMES VIDEO MOVIES BLOGS STORE PARKS *Disney Movie Rewards membership required. Only includes tickets to the 91st Annual Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Travel, accommodations and expenses are not included. Limited quantities. See Reward for details. Reward is 10,000 points for one pair of tickets. Visit DisneyMovieRewards.com for eligibility, requirements, details, Terms and Conditions, point collection and redemption details and expiration dates. Although we do not believe this unusual activity affected your pier1.â€‹com account, as a precaution, we have reset your clave. Please follow the steps below to create a new clave for your pier1.â€‹com account: Visit the Pier 1 clave Reset Page and follow the onscreen instructions. OR Visit www.pier1.â€‹com Under â€˜Account,â€™ click â€˜Forgot/Update clave?â€™ Enter the login email address associated with your account and click â€˜Reset clave.â€™ Check your email for a message from Pier 1 Imports with the subject line â€˜Important clave Information.â€™ Follow the instructions in the email to visit a secure page and reset your clave to a new clave that you have not previously used. You will receive an email message confirming you have successfully reset your clave. As a best practice, please keep in mind that stronger claves are those that are longer and combine upper and lowercase letters, numbers and symbols and are not words that appear in the dictionary. You should also avoid using the same clave for multiple online accounts. Please note this is in reference to the account you use to access pier1.com online and not related to the Pier 1 Rewards Credit Card. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. subject: 5 things I'm digging â€“ October edition
full_text: It's been busy at the Ugmonk HQ with the launch of the 9th Anniversary Set and sale. Hundreds of orders are going out the door and will be landing in your mailboxes soon. I've also beenÂ busy working on 7 new products to release in time forÂ the holidays. . . . . . Here areÂ 5 things Iâ€™m currently digging... 1. It's not often you see mainstream culture making font jokes, but this SNL skit is hilarious and so on point. ðŸ˜‚ 2. I'm thoroughly enjoyingÂ Jocelyn K. Glei's newÂ Hurry Slowly podcast. It'sÂ focused on how you can be more productive, creative, and resilient through the simple act of slowing down.Â Listen hereÂ or inÂ iTunes 3. This guy breaks down why you can't win at most carnival games. I knew about some of these, but I love that someone took the time toÂ break down the science behind what makes them nearly impossible to win. 4. Travel goal: Eat atÂ this newÂ underwater restaurant in Norway. 5. I just received thisÂ incredibly beautiful Illuminated BibleÂ by my friendÂ Dana TamanachiÂ and am blown away by the detail and quality.Â Dana is one of theÂ most talented letterers in the world andÂ did over 500 hand-lettered illustrationsÂ that are printed in gold ink throughout the Bible. I've always been a visual learner andÂ these illustrations are helping me engage with the contentÂ in a new way.Â Pre-order it here . . . . . We are just weeks away from meeting the newest member of the Ugmonk family :) Hope you have anÂ awesome Friday! - Jeff . . . . . P.S. Here's a list of the 30Â tools I use to run Ugmonk. subject: 8 of my favorite things
full_text: I did a fun interview with a new site calledÂ MinimumsÂ featuring â€œthe most interesting possessions of the worldâ€™s most interesting people.â€ While I don't really consider myselfÂ one of the world's most interesting people,Â it was fun to think about 8 of my favorite things and what they mean to me. I selected some of the items based on their utility and daily use, and other items for their sentimental value and the stories behind them. If there's one possession I really can't live without, I would say it's myÂ sketchbooks.Â Iâ€™ve always been a visual thinker. Ever since I was a kid I loved drawing and sketching and could spend hours with just a stack of blank paper and some pencils. ThroughoutÂ school, Iâ€™d fill the margins of my notebooks and book covers with all sorts of doodles and drawings.Â That hasnâ€™t changed much :) Shop the Workspace Collection â†’ Thanks for your support! subject: A Small Part Of Something Big
full_text: . . . . . A Small Part of Something Big My wife and I had the privilege to return to Honduras to visit some of the orphanages that we support through ourÂ Charity Drive in partnership with Rice Bowls. Itâ€™s been awesome building deeper and deeper relationships with the kids each time we visit. We gave endless piggyback rides, played soccer and basketball, and got teased for our terrible Spanishâ€¦ it was an exhausting week but I wouldnâ€™t trade it for anything. (As you can see from the photos these kids are full of energy!) From the outside it may seem illogical to take a whole week off when thereâ€™s so much work to get done and emails piling up, but I canâ€™t even tell you how refreshing it is to step away from my desk and be 100% present serving these kids. One thing Iâ€™ve learned in life (and running a business) is that our lives will always be busy and only get busier. Sometimes you have to force yourself to break away and do the things that you â€œhope to get around toâ€ someday. Whether thatâ€™s helping at an orphanage or visiting a family member you havenâ€™t seen in a while, you wonâ€™t regret it. Thanks to all of you who help us feed these beautiful kids and play a small part of something big! Learn more about Rice Bowls and how to get involved. Learn more about how we give back â†’ We donate a meal to needy kids around the world for every Ugmonk product purchased. We do this by partnering with a great organization called Rice BowlsÂ who is extremely efficient in stewarding the donations they receive in order to serve the children in orphanages around the globe. WithÂ your support we've provided overÂ over 45,000 meals for needy kids around the world! Learn more about how we give back â†’ Thanks for your continued support! full_text: Cotton Bureau This week on Cotton Bureau... What to Feed a Millennial by Michelle Rial Meat? Gluten? Nightshades? Nope, nope, and nope. Good thing Michelle Rial cracked the code with "What to Feed a Millennial." Pre-order on poly-cotton sand, tri-blend heather white, or heather grey until Friday, November 3 at 8pm Eastern. Now on to a few more of our favorite teesâ€¦ Read Fast, Live Slow by Piet Aukeman God Save the Queen by Nancy Bradham Yol-K. by Cade Buckus Alien Invasion by Arif Rahman Fake It till You Make It by Mark & Type Farm Fed by Brittany Phillips Design Shop all shirts Meet our factory Blank marks our first attempt at making our own t-shirts. It's exciting, challenging, and a little overwhelming. We knew nothing when we started. We know a little more now. But for everything we don't know, our factory partner is there to teach us. We can tell you more about them, but we think it's better to just show you. Meet our factory. #CBescaperoom Something spoopy is going on at Cotton Bureau. subject: Stranger Tees Have Happened
full_text: The upside down Clear your schedule, it's time to binge... on Stranger Tees! We put our fears aside and searched Hawkins high and low to find Eleven otherworldly designs for you to get cozy in this season. Alright there are actually more than that; we got a little scared along the way but didn't wanna feel left out, so we ran home and made two of our own tees. We've got Barb, the A.V. Club, and Hawkins High all covered, and a few more in case some of them succumb to the Upside Down ðŸ˜¬. If only we had some psychokinetic powers of our own to drop these right into your cart. That's probably best left up to you though, so maybe you can ask the Ouija wall to help you decide. And don't forget, some of these have matching sweatshirts! So come on in and find your favorites, but be carefulâ€¦ the door to these tees can and will close (in two weeks when their campaigns are over). Hawkins Middle A.V.
