subject: Exciting news! Bucketfeet is joining Threadless.
full_text: Threadless + Bucketfeet = a match made in heaven Email not displaying correctly? View in browser. Threadless Shop All Designs Dear Threadless Fam, Itâ€™s an exciting day here at our company. We just acquired and joined forces with made-to-order shoe brand, Bucketfeet! Just like us, Bucketfeetâ€™s mission is to support artists, giving them a platform to sell their designs on footwear. And theyâ€™ve done a killer job, selling over 1M shoes! Bucketfeet has been making serious strides (no pun intended) since 2011, and we couldnâ€™t be happier to have them join us here at Threadless. This addition means a few things for our company and a few exciting new opportunities for you as a member of our community. First and foremost, weâ€™re welcoming an entirely new artist community from Bucketfeet into Threadless, which means there will be even more artists for you to discover. And yes, it also means that - *drum roll* - we will be expanding our product catalog to include shoes. Now, you can support artists by wearing their art on your feet! Donâ€™t worry; the Bucketfeet brand isnâ€™t going anywhere. Their website will be fully shoppable through the holidays, but in the coming months you will see our brands fusing more and more. Weâ€™ll be launching a few shoe design challenges in the next few weeks and kicking off next year, we plan on integrating footwear into both Threadless and Artist Shops. Threadless was founded in 2000 to support independent artists through apparel and Bucketfeet was founded in 2011 to support independent artists through footwear. By combining our communities and resources, weâ€™re giving artists a whole new way to feature their art and to do what Threadless has always set out to do: make great together. The team over at Bucketfeet has written a heartfelt letter celebrating our partnership, which you can read here. Head over to Bucketfeet to shop our most recent Threadless collection and be sure to check out all the other art featured on shoes, especially this Halloween themed series. If you see a pair you like, snag them for 30% off; on us! Just use the code below* and get yourself some new kicks: YAYBFTH9138 If you have any questions or just want to send us a celebratory GIF, please feel free to reply to this email. And head over to the Chicago Tribune to read our interview and see first-hand why this partnership is a match made in shoe heaven. Thank you for being part of our journey in making great together! - Your Solemates, Jake and the Threadless Team *Code expiresÂ 10/30 at 10AMÂ CST. Code valid onÂ bucketfeet.com. Bucketfeet currently ships domestically to the United States only. full_text: Hi lorem ipsum, Martin Reilly here. All of these drugs are â€œanticholinergicâ€, which means they block the crucial neurotransmitter acetylcholine (Alzheimer's is characterized by a drop in acetylcholine), and are therefore toxic to the brain. According to the study at Indiana University, participants taking at least one of these drugs performed worse on cognitive tests, had lower glucose metabolism in the hippocampus (and overall brain) as well as displaying reduced brain volume and larger cavities inside the brain than normal. Are you or a loved one taking any of these meds? 1. Sedating antihistamines. Used to treat allergies such as hay fever, diphenhydramine (brand name Benadryl), can be bought over-the-counter, yet itâ€™s a powerful anticholinergic. 2. Night-time versions of over-the-counter (OTC) cold and cough medicines. To help you sleep, many OTC cold and cough medicines, such as Nyquil, are available in a â€˜night-time formulationâ€™. This means a mild sedative â€” usually an antihistamine â€” has been added. The same can be said for OTC night-time painkillers like acetaminophen and ibuprofen (brand names Tylenol and Motrin). 3. Muscle relaxants. These include drugs such as cyclobenzaprine (brand name Flexeril) which are often prescribed for back or neck pain. 4. Medications for an over-active bladder. These include bladder relaxants such as oxybutynin and tolterodine (brand names Ditropan and Detrol). 5. Medications for nerve pain. An older class of antidepressant known as â€œtricyclicsâ€ is still regularly used to treat neuropathic pain (nerve damage often caused by diabetes). subject: The Internet of Things and your security
full_text: December 2017 Newsletter Malwarebytes www.malwarebytes.com Internet of Things (IoT) security: what is and what should never be The Internet has penetrated seemingly all technological advances today, resulting in Internet for ALL THE THINGS. What was once confined to a desktop and a phone jack is now networked and connected in multiple devices, from home heating and cooling systems like the Nest to AI companions such as Alexa. The devices can pass information through the web to anywhere in the worldâ€”server farmers, company databases, your own phone. With the promise of this new technology comes substantial security risk. What does it mean to you, and what can you do to protect yourself? subject: All about ransomware
full_text: Having trouble viewing this message? Click here to view this as a webpage. Malwarebytes January 2018 Newsletter Malwarebytes www.malwarebytes.com All about ransomware Ransomware grabbed headlines in 2017, with massive outbreaks affecting people and businesses worldwide. Led by WannaCry, NotPetya, and BadRabbit (names from a failed James Bond script?), ransomware resulted in millions of dollars paid in ransom, locked files, and late nights for anyone concerned about cybersecurity. And that, my friend, may have been you. So we're here to help. We gathered everything you need to know about ransomware in one reference page. Its history, how to protect against it, what to do if you're infectedâ€”it's all there. We'll keep the page updated with the latest on major ransomware outbreaks (so you might want to bookmark it or add it to your RSS feed). Take a look Latest news and research Take a survey and help us build a stronger, smarter newsletter Answer a handful of questions in the time it takes to pour yourself a beer, and we'll make a good thing better. Keep reading Meltdown and Spectre: what you need to know 2018 gets off to a rough start as manufacturers and software vendors tackle a series of severe vulnerabilities called Meltdown and Spectre (a proper Bond name) that affect all modern computers. Keep reading Cookies: Should I worry about them? Are cookies a threat to privacy? Or just a little piece of code that makes your life easier? The answer depends on how much you care about privacy. Learn how to manage your cookies. subject: Free Big Crunch Pepero! No strings attached.
full_text: Seriously, it's totally free. Hi Lorem Ipsum! Today marks our 4 year anniversary from when we launched! We wanted to reach out to personally thank you for believing in and supporting our vision of bringing awesome international snacks to the masses! This holiday season, we will be running various deals for new customers. But, what about if you're a current customer? What's in it for you? Great news! We're not like your cell phone provider or cable company; we like to take care of our existing customers as well! As a current subscriber, you will automatically get hooked up with a free box of XL Big Crunch Pepero in your January MunchPak! Pretty freakin sweet, eh? Btw, if you're looking to give a unique gift this holiday season, we'll be running some great deals on Cyber Monday. Your giftee will also receive a free XL Big Crunch Pepero in their January MunchPak as a bonus! *Unfortunately, the XL Pepero is too large to fit in the MunchPak Mini so this offer is only available to customers who receive an Original MunchPak (10+ snacks) or FamilyPak (20+ snacks) in January 2018. Happy Holidays! The MunchPak Team Image credit: Oprah Copyright Â© 2017 MunchPak.com, All rights reserved.
